Ichthypod_Crane, i think you pretty much nailed it. of slight interest is that epic as a line had faded as an imprint in the early '90s, and heavy hitters was in effect, a relaunch to try to regain some of the sales and critical acclaim that '80s epic titles had.

it's also an interesting footnote that when marvel president terry stewart was confronted by todd mcfarlane, jim lee, rob liefeld and the gang in '91 or '92, stewart offered to give them the entire epic line for the creator-owned books they wanted to do. they balked and literally walked to a meeting with malibu graphics to launch image comics.
